How can I use the `getblockcount` command in Verus?

You can use the `getblockcount` command in Verus by running the following command in your terminal:
```
> verus getblockcount
```
Alternatively, you can also use the `getblockcount` method with JSON-RPC by sending a request to the Verus node, like this:
```
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblockcount", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Note: You need to replace `myusername` with your actual username and `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the URL of your Verus node.

getblockcount Returns the number of blocks in the best valid block chain. Result: n  (numeric) The current block count Examples: > verus getblockcount > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblockcount", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
